name: Stora Enso AB
goal:
Stora Enso is a leading provider of renewable solutions in packaging, biomaterials, wooden constructions and paper globally. Our materials are renewable, reusable, and recyclable, and form the building blocks for a range of innovative solutions that can help replace products based on fossil fuels and other non-renewable materials.

The Group employ some 26 000 people in more than 35 countries, and is publicly traded in Helsinki and Stockholm. In 2017, Group sales totalled EUR 10 billion and operational EBIT EUR 1 billion.

We make every effort to use 100% of a tree, for the board, timber, paper and other products, as well as bioenergy. In production, we are driving down the use of fossil fuels and pushing towards carbon neutrality as much as it is technically and commercially feasible. We practice and promote sustainable forestry and work to ensure that more trees are planted than are harvested.
interests: Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Environment, Research and innovation, Taxation
euInitiatives: Bioeconomy, EIP raw materials, energy, biofuels, climate change, transport, EFSI, sustainability, innovation, wooden Constructions, recycling
